summary: This bill, HR 5247, focuses on restructuring the Department of State's International Security Affairs authorities. It establishes an Under Secretary for International Security Affairs with broad responsibilities, including oversight of international security policy, arms control, counterterrorism, and transnational crime. The bill also details the roles and responsibilities of various Assistant Secretaries and Bureaus within the Department, including those focused on trafficking, political-military affairs, narcotics and law enforcement, arms control and nonproliferation, counterterrorism, and emerging threats. It also addresses the authorization of appropriations for these areas.
